text: They will re-ban it if necessary
People haven't really had a chance to react yet too. Folks have only been able to add it, not to see who is exactly adding it.
I had it win two games in a row
Once it won through two counterspells and a removal spell. The other time the flash hulk player went first and combo'd off before anyone else got their third turn.

I'll be curious to see if it gets re-banned. It feels like a really meta-dependent thing. Flash/Hulk would get you made fun of in the shop I play at and you'd get mocked out of the room for wasting everyone's time. That's certainly not true everywhere.

There are plenty of turn 3 decks that don't require Flash Hulk, although Flash Hulk is certainly one very good way to win on turn 3. It's just odd that Flash Hulk is a problem in some groups but groups don't report having issues with things like Selvala, Heart of the Wilds, Food Chain and Doomsday-- other ways to win by turn 3, or turn 4 with counterspell back-up. I can see Flash or Hulk getting banned precisely because it warps some games, it's just so weird to me how other things-- arguably stronger things-- somehow don't cause these problems and thus fly under the banlist radar. EDH is an odd format.
That said, I built a Thrasios+Tymna Flash Hulk list, so let me have my fun first! :stuck_out_tongue:
but if it wasn't Hulk, I'd just be playing Boonweaver Giant, which is worse but not so much worse that I'd scrap the entire deck.
literally the only changes I'd make to my deck if Hulk got banned was to swap Hulk and Flash for Boonweaver Giant and Reveilark.
It's crazy that I'd never heard of the Boonweaver combo until I joined this group
And now apparently it's a real thing
Boonweaver was always a thing

Boonweaver is great. It's basically strictly worse than Protean Hulk though. (Protean Hulk doesn't require Reveilark to combo off, and Hulk is harder to respond to because it doesn't fall as flat on its face to instant speed creature spot removal.)

Hulk is a mostly-strictly-better upgrade over Boonweaver, not only because of Flash but for so many other reasons. Boonweaver's a bit slower, and I can see why Hulk would cause problems in groups when Karador didn't. But I think a lot of people playing Hulk now just decided, "oh hey Hulk is unbanned, let me break this" whereas everyone at my LGS who's now playing Flash Hulk (me and another guy) used to be Karador boonweaver players. It's weird how it works, like, there was this perfectly fine "tier 1.5" competitive deck that people always had access to, and a card for it gets unbanned and now everyone wants to play it even though it
's not THAT much better

The main upgrade is the occasional turn 1-3 win you can get off Flash Hulk-- which is nontrivial, like gosh it's so much easier to win faster now,. But the deck still folds to a lot of the same things (graveyard hate is a big one), still uses the same interaction package re: hatebears so the interaction has those same strengths/weaknesses.
people like having new shiny objects I guess
if boonweaver giant was banned then became unbanned people would probably be playing that, lol.

The percentage of edh players who run Boonweaver (or will run Flash Hulk) is the equivalent of a rounding error, too. The percentage seems higher here because among people who write about EDH, listen to podcasts about it, dig into the guts of EDHREC, etc. are a pretty self-selecting group, but it's certainly not the norm.
my LGS has like 6 people from the cEDH discord/subreddit, as well as 2 mods there, lol. So I see a lot of that stuff.
but yeah, most people will use hulk for value
not for instant wins.
Where as something like Sylvan or Prophet Leovold just accidentally disrupted games.
I wonder if people losing to the instant wins become vocal enough to get flash or hulk banned. Hopefully if something gets banned it's Flash, not hulk.
At a casual level
I don't think any deck playing Leovold is casual, that's the thing.
It's a $70 3-color card.
I guess at one point it was $10
I've seen a couple, mostly people who cracked it in draft and built elves or something quick

the Leovold thing to me is really fascinating.... it's a brutal card, but also not the LITERAL strongest thing you can build. But you'd think things that are that brutal would be regulated out of groups via social contract?
That said, you can hate Leovold off the table when you see it as the commander; Flash/Hulk win is tougher to as a group decide "no!"

the thing about Prophet of Kruphix is that you can like, slap that into a mediocre deck, and nobody says "ew your deck is broken" but it still warps the game. Leovold is just.... you're playing it, and people instantly complain. That seems like the type of things groups would be able to regulate out.
Yeah, Leovold at my store went away due to people just realizing it made for unfun games and yanking it and because you got hated out.
Right, that was the Prophet problem, it just became so centraizing. People started rotating clones in just to copy Prophet, etc. That's just annoying.
I hadn't played against much Leovold but lemme say, playing Yisan against Leovold was pretty fun. :wink: Nobody has cards and I'm just sitting here tutoring for creatures each turn.
I don't mind Leo being out but it didn't feel necessary as a ban
Problem with Yisan is every game is the same
You can see by like turn two if you've won or not
I ran him right after he came out and had a blast the first couple games, then got so bored.

it's not the saddest ban but it's not the most justified either. I think my problem with the Leovold ban is that groups should have been able to regulate it out. Prophet of Kruphix is trickier to regulate out because it's not inherently a card that people scream "UGH YOUR DECK IS BROKEN" about, yet still warps casual games. But Leovold is like...... why are you playing against the Leovold player if it's that problematic?!?!???
Right
it's not like it's a surprise if you sit down at a table, someone busts out leovold, and you get locked out of your cards.
and like at my LGS I can't say "well I dont want to play with that!" if I buy into the league for packs, but I mean, if packs are on the line, why shouldnt people bring the most brutal things?

I kind of hate to make this generalization because it's absolutely NOT true everywhere, but I look at my store, the people there, the games we play, the environment, and think "why the hell would you play with or even be friends with someone who thinks Leovold is fun?"
I honestly would play Leovold if I had Timetwister :stuck_out_tongue:
Packs on the line changes the equation greatly, too
and that makes you a bad person
Playing competitive is a whole different deal.
I never minded playing against Leovold too, I mean it locks the game but I think it creates a fun dynamic. I like cutthroat stuff. Zur scares me more.
but yeah idk. if I'm just sitting down with people and I have a casual deck with no combos
and someone sits down with Leovold.
I'm probably not playing with him/her.
problem solved no bans.
:open_mouth:
Particularly if that person doesnt' get why that's a problem in that environment
oh they probably know why
Eh, there's a lot of somewhat socially inept magic players :slightly_smiling_face:
Get gud, son, etc.
I guess.
I mean there are some elements of "get gud son" against Leovold, like Leovold isn't unanswerable.
that said it was, unarguably, a tier 1 deck.
You should listen to the latest CommanderingMTG podcast episode where they talk to Sheldon about Leo's banning, etc.
oh do they?
Yup
neat. I'll check it out then.
Sheldon's probably not gonna convince me that Leo deserved a ban for my aforementioned reasons, but still worth hearing why he did it in detail.

If I had Leovold with me and wanted to play him, I made sure I was the last person to take my deck out to scout how scornful a reaction I would get. If the people were pulling out powerful commanders I would still double check, but if they were playing tribal allies or something like that, I didn't even bother
So many problems in commander go away if people just do that stuff

But yea, like you guys already said, it requires some amount of responsibility in choosing a deck for the setting. Which if you're unaware of your surroundings as most players can be, there's no point in trusting someone who shouldn't be trusted anyways

yeah I think that's the right approach. It's weird that in a format based on social contracts, that Sheldon thought it was necessary to ban a commander that you see before you start games and people get to make a conscious choice on whether they want to sit down and play against it.
Yep. What's so bad about getting up and finding a new game
I'd argue Narset causes more issues than Leo in that regard.
Or just being a human and communicating that you'd prefer not to waste your time with Leo
Narset is interesting because you can build bad Narset decks and great Narset decks
and there are a lot of both kinds
<@U4V5EHQ2G> totally agree. I have both
True
Had
Leovold is just.... if you're building Leovold people KNOW to expect the worst
Narset though is a deck that plays individual stupid powerful cards. So even if Narset doesn't happen, time stretch is still time stretch
I guess Narset you should expect the same thing, but Narset mostly synergizes with $20+ extra turn cards whereas Leovold synergizes with $1.00 cards like Windfall.
Leo decks without Leovold out on the board was actively a terrible deck.

You could probably sit down with three players with precons, and working together you can keep Leo off the field and in check most of the time. Obviously some perfect builds and perfect pilots would beat you, but you can deal with it. There's lots of decks where you just can't respond to Narset.
Narset's not really that great anymore because mulligan changes reduce the consistency a lot. I've played against Narset like 5 times at my LGS and I've seen it go off like... once.
If nobody is playing an edict effect Narset can literally be impossible to deal with
but yeah it's hard to answer in a lot of ways.
Good point though that a great narset build is way more pricey than a great Leo guild
I mean refined leovold is going to run a lot of money-- timetwister is more expensive than capture of jhinzou
but windfall is cheap and brutal
<@U4BFDSLKT> will attest that my Narset deck probably has a 75% success rate when it's not "3v1"
Leo always got hated out so fast that before anything eventful happens it cost 7+ to cast my Commander

now that I think about it, I probably wouldn't even play Leovold. Because I'd only be able to play it with my competitive friends, and no amount of card changes to make it less brutal would ever convince my casual friends that it's OK. Like I can sub out Staff of Domination and Umbral Mantle for eldrazi titans in my Selvala list and it's like, "ok you got out turn 4 ulamog instead of a turn 3 win."
so that's kind of important I think. Just a deck you can't even play anywhere.

I actually had the cards but never had the opportunity to play Leovold as a a voltron deck, with the steel of the godhead type enchantments to make it more "oh hey look how silly this is " with no wheels and dickery
leovold is strong even as a hatebear lol. It'd still be surprisingly annoying.
Definitely suffered from that rafiq problem I hear about
The problem with Leovold is he's just annoying even in a janky silly deck. You're still shutting off everyone's Brainstorm and Sign in Blood. People still gun for you because it's irritating.
So there's no real casual Leovold build. All you do building a silly version is die faster. People don't hold back because it's still frustrating to have on the field.
Yup.
Thank god it's still legal in tiny leaders
Tiny is 1v1 right?
Hell if I know
lol
It's an imaginary format as far as I can tell
I've seen a game of tl played in person
It was our local try hards and I didn't pay attention because of it
It's the same as frontier. Heard but not seen
My buddy who works at our lgs was all about it just because they had a 1 k of siege rhinos and mantis riders the wanted to get rid of
We see a bit of frontier, but I'm curious how much of that is/was people annoyed at Copter then Copycast
cat

Sure
A Grad Prix?
Or some kind of commander event
There is something in the works
United night of Commander by EDHREC?
Partner with LGS' all over?

I kind of want to run commander events out of it at night

Zealot, gargoyle, slug didnt make it in

He made it

Seems prudent
Removed crucible of wolrds
Tabernacle went into my mono black deck, not sure why it wasnt there
The two lands replaced forests
Dropped scooze
You're breaking my heart Don. What did Mr. Scooze do to hurt you?
